subSections.title: Alternative forms
Etymology
subSections.text:
{{IPAchar|/katuwo/}} → {{IPAchar|/kat͡suwo/}} → {{IPAchar|/kat͡suo/}}

Two possible derivations:
* A shift from a compound of {{com|ja|sort=かつお|堅|tr1=kata|pos=stem meaning "[[firm]], [[hard]]"|魚|tr2=uo|t2=[[fish]]}}, from the long-standing practice of drying lower-grade tuna into hard blocks. A [[folk etymology]] also derives this ''[[kanji]]'' character, compare {{ja-l|木工}} → {{m|ja|杢|tr=moku||[[woodworker]]|pos=archaic}} and {{ja-l|麻呂}} → {{m|ja|麿|tr=maro|pos=[[first-person]] [[pronoun]], archaic}}.
* A shift from a compound of {{com|ja|勝つ|tr1=katsu|t1=to [[win]]|魚|tr2=uo|t2=fish}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|かつお|カツオ|hhira=かつを|hkata=カツヲ}}

# a [[skipjack tuna]], ''[[Katsuwonus pelamis]]''
# {{short for|lang=ja|鰹木|tr=katsuogi|dot=:}} a [[log]] on the [[roof]] of a [[shrine]] [[set]] [[perpendicular]] to the [[ridgepole]]
# {{short for|lang=ja|鰹節|tr=[[katsuobushi]]|dot=:}} [[smoke#Verb|smoked]] and [[dried]] skipjack tuna
# {{lb|ja|sort=かつお|obsolete}} {{short for|lang=ja|鰹虫|tr=katsuomushi|dot=:}} a [[biting midge]]; a [[water strider]]
